name: CHARLES MENG
objective: To pursue a master’s degree in Computer Science and contribute to the field of assistive technologies through research and community engagement.
summary: This resume highlights Charles Meng’s academic achievements and contributions to assistive technology and computer science.

education.degree: Master of Engineering in Computer Science

education.institution: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

experience.company: User Interface Design Group; CSAIL, MIT
experience.description: Designed search tools for code submission feedback and built search engines to improve efficiency. Developed clustering techniques for powergrading students’ code.
Led MIT undergrad courses on assistive technology. Founding member of the first MIT assistive tech hackathon and recruited five clients.

experience.company: Introduction to Electrical Engineering and Computer Science; MIT
experience.description: Managed lab assistants and delivered lectures on computer science concepts to over 500 students.

experience.company: Middle East Education Through Technology (MEET) - Jerusalem, Israel
experience.description: Developed a 3-week curriculum to teach web programming and Django to Israeli and Palestinian high-schoolers.

experience.company: MIT International Science and Technology Initiative - Querétaro, Mexico
experience.description: Established a class tailored to Mexican street children and taught in Spanish.
Created a user interface for cloud-based virtual environments and presented in Spanish before cloud computing professionals.

experience.company: Affective Computing; Media Lab, MIT - Cambridge, MA
experience.description: Introduced a user interface for CardioCam, a non-contact heart rate and blood pressure device.

projects.title: SPLASH Underserved Student Recruiter and Teacher
projects.description: Communicated with primary contacts at various low-income high schools in the Bay Area to attract students to Fall SPLASH 2012. Taught biology and history classes on lactose intolerance.

projects.title: ThinkMath Instructor, Trainer, and Assistant Team Lead
projects.description: Taught Singaporean math curriculum and led training sessions for new instructors about lesson planning.

skills: Django, WebDev Languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery), Python, C++, Java, MATLAB
Group leader for MIT Varsity Track and Field pole vaulters
Spanish, Hebrew, Pole vaulting, Gymnastics, Travel, Music
